data.author: Dave Becker-Ellison

data.text: I plan the route and book beforehand. Specially if itâ€™s a popular route for cyclists.
data.author: Juan A. Rodriguez

data.text: We prepare a list of hotels along the route before we go. Each evening, when we get off the road we use our smart phone to get the accommodation for the next night. This system is dependent on not traveling in peak season or to very popular areas with limited resources. In those situations we book ahead, but you lose flexibility.
data.author: Robin Verner

data.text: We usually just wing it, and maybe book midday when we have a sense for where we might be that night. If in a popular area with limited hotel selection, it pays to book in advance.
data.author: Dave Elmstrom

data.text: I tend to pre-book camp sites ahead of time. I aim for small, basic sites that have less than 20 pitches and sometimes are a bit more "rustic". I haven't quite worked myself up to wild camping yet. I like a shower in the morning. But I bring a cook set and some food/stock up en route.
data.author: Jayme Fraioli-Harper

data.text: Looks like what you want to do is a Credit Card Tour where you ride and stay at hotels, not necessarily bikepacking in which you pack your sleeping system and camp.
